page.title: 18PRIVATE SCHOOL
page.content: Hazlegrove House School: Situated just off the A303, Hazlegrove has a very scenic setting with a large park, full with trees. Although many Elms were killed due to Dutch Elm disease, an attempt is being made to make a new grove. A wide range of sports and hobbies are taught and encouraged all through the year, ranging from codes to gardening to rugby. A sports hall, called The Dolphin Hall, can be used for a variety of sports: Hockey, Basketball, Tennis, Badminton and many others. Ajoined to this is a Chapel / Cinema / Theatre / Assembly Hall. Also ajoined to the sports hall are two squash courts. The school also has some woods around the back, where the boys enjoy building dens.
